title: ICT Police FM 92.4 airs 71 awareness shows, over 9,000 safety messages
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 01 (APP):Islamabad Capital Territory (ICT) Police FM Radio 92.4 aired 71 public awareness programs, 390 traffic updates, and over 9,000 road safety messages during the current month.
A public relations officer told APP on Sunday that the ICT Police Radio aired 71 public awareness programs, 390 traffic updates, and more than 9,000 road safety awareness messages during the current month.
The radio service is also keeping citizens informed on a daily basis about weather alerts and emergency conditions through regular broadcasts.
He said FM 92.4 is not only providing up-to-date traffic information but also airing special messages related to weather and emergencies. Citizens of the federal capital can participate in live programs by calling 051-9263184 and share their valuable feedback with the police.
He said Islamabad Police regularly uses FM Radio 92.4 to issue traffic alerts, safety tips, and to broadcast recreational and informative programs. Special alerts are also shared using Safe City cameras to inform the public about emergency or weather-related developments.
He said citizens can also register complaints against any police official or share their queries by sending a message to 4471. In addition, they can participate in live streaming sessions through various social media platforms.
Chief Traffic Officer (CTO) Captain (R) Syed Zeeshan Haider, said the Islamabad Police is committed to engaging with the public both practically and through audio-visual means. The police are taking every possible step to ensure the safety and security of citizens.
